schedule:
W1 
(1) Introduction to Statistics and Data Analysis：Sampling Procedures, Sample Mean and Median, Measures of Variability, Discrete and Continuous Data
W2
(1) Introduction to Statistics and Data Analysis：Statistical Modeling, Scientific Inspection, and Graphical Diagnostics
(2) Probability：Sample Space, Events, Counting Sample Points
W3
(2) Probability：Counting Sample Points, Additive Rules, Conditional Probability, Independence Probability, the Product Rule, Bayes’ Rule
W4
(2) Probability：Independence Probability, the Product Rule, Bayes’ Rule
W5
(3) Random Variables and Probability Distributions：Concept of a Random Variable, Discrete Probability Distributions
W6
(3) Random Variables and Probability Distributions：Continuous Probability Distributions, Joint Probability Distributions
W7
(4)　　Mathematical Expectation：Mean of a Random Variable, Variance and Covariance of Random Variables
W8
(4)　　Mathematical Expectation：Means and Variances of Linear Combinations of Random Variables, Chebyshev’s Theorem
W9
Midterm Exam
W10
(5)　　Discrete Probability Distributions：Introduction and Motivation，Binomial and Multinomial Distributions, Hypergeometric Distribution
W11
(5)　　Discrete Probability Distributions：Negative Binomial and Geometric Distributions, Poisson Distribution and the Poisson Process
W12
(6)　　Continuous Probability Distributions：Continuous Uniform Distribution, Normal Distribution, Areas under the Normal Curve, Applications of the Normal Distribution
W13
(6)　　Continuous Probability Distributions：Normal Approximation to the Binomial, Gamma and Exponential Distributions, Chi-Squared Distribution, Beta Distribution, Lognormal Distribution
W14

W15
(7)　　Fundamental Sampling Distributions and Data Descriptions：Sampling Distribution of S2, t-Distribution, F-Distribution, Quantile and Probability Plots
W16

W17

W18
Final Exam
